sen.j: 遠智娘（おちのいらつめ、生没年不詳）は飛鳥時代の豪族蘇我氏の蘇我倉山田石川麻呂（蘇我入鹿のいとこ）の娘。
sen.e: Ochi no iratsume (year of birth and death unknown) was a daughter of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro who was a cousin of SOGA no Iruka and a member of the Soga clan, a powerful family in the Asuka period.

Ochi no iratsume (year of birth and death unknown) was a daughter of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro who was a cousin of SOGA no Iruka and a member of the Soga clan, a local ruling family called Gozoku in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 「豪族」をa local ruling family called Gozokuに変更しました。
sen.e: Ochi no iratsume (year of birth and death unknown) was a daughter of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro who was a cousin of SOGA no Iruka and a member of the Soga clan, a local ruling family called Gozoku in the Asuka period.

sen.j: またの名を造媛、美濃津子娘とも伝えられている。
sen.e: She was also called Miyatsuko-hime or Minotsuko no iratsume.
sen.cmt: 造媛Miyatsuko-hime美濃津子娘Minotsuko no iratsume
sen.e: She was also called Miyatsuko-hime or Minotsuko no iratsume.
She was also called Miyatsuko-hime or Minotsuko no iratsume.

sen.j: 遅くとも、大化の改新以前（644年という説有り）に中大兄皇子（後の天智天皇）に嫁した。
sen.e: At the latest, by Taika no Kaishin (Great Reformation of the Taika Era of 645), she married Naka no Oe no Oji (Prince Naka no Oe) who later became Emperor Tenji (Emperor Tenchi); some historian says the marriage was in 644.
Before Taika no Kaishin (Great Reformation of the Taika Era of 645) at the latest, she married Naka no Oe no Oji (Prince Naka no Oe, later Emperor Tenji), and some says it was in 644.
Before Taika no Kaishin (Great Reformation of the Taika Era of 645) at the latest, she married Naka no Oe no Oji (Prince Naka no Oe, later Emperor Tenji), and some says it was in 644.

sen.j: 妹に姪娘がおり、同じく中大兄皇子に嫁して御名部皇女と阿陪皇女（後の元明天皇）の二女を産む。
sen.e: One of her sister was Mei no iratsume, she also married Naka no Oe no Oji, and had two daughters, Minabe no Himemiko (Princess Minabe) and Ahe no Himemiko (Princess Ahe who became Empress Genmei).
She had a sister Mei no iratsume, who also married Naka no Oe no Oji and had two daughters, Minabe no Himemiko (Princess Minabe) and Ahe no Himemiko (Princess Ahe, later Empress Genmei).
sen.cmt: 前半を言い換えました。
sen.e: She had a sister Mei no iratsume, who also married Naka no Oe no Oji and had two daughters, Minabe no Himemiko (Princess Minabe) and Ahe no Himemiko (Princess Ahe, later Empress Genmei).

sen.j: 同じ天智天皇に嫁いだ蘇我赤兄の娘、常陸娘と天武天皇に嫁いだ大蕤娘とは従姉妹にあたる。
sen.e: Among her cousins, Hitachi no iratsume, a daughter of SOGA no Akae, married Emperor Tenji as well, and Onu no iratsume married Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: 常陸娘Hitachi no iratsume大蕤娘Onu no iratsume
sen.e: Hitachi no iratsume, who was a daughter of SOGA no Akae and also married Emperor Tenji, and Onu no iratsume, who married Emperor Tenmu, were her cousins.
sen.cmt: 常陸娘と大蕤娘を主語にして言い換えました。
sen.e: Hitachi no iratsume, who was a daughter of SOGA no Akae and also married Emperor Tenji, and Onu no iratsume, who married Emperor Tenmu, were her cousins.

sen.j: 当時、彼女は古人大兄皇子の娘で天智天皇の皇后である倭姫王に次ぐ高貴な血筋の嬪であった。
sen.e: At that time, Ochi no iratsume was counted as the second noblest Mime (women for emperor), next to Yamato no Hime Okimi who was a daughter of Furuhito no Oe no Miko (Prince Furuhito no Oe) and the lawful wife of Emperor Tenji.

At that time, she was counted as the second noblest hin (an imperial wife of the lowest rank), next to Yamato no Hime Okimi who was a daughter of Furuhito no Oe no Miko (Prince Furuhito no Oe) and the lawful wife of Emperor Tenji.
sen.cmt: 主語をsheに変え、「嬪」をhin (an imperial wife of the lowest rank)としました。
sen.e: At that time, she was counted as the second noblest hin (an imperial wife of the lowest rank), next to Yamato no Hime Okimi who was a daughter of Furuhito no Oe no Miko (Prince Furuhito no Oe) and the lawful wife of Emperor Tenji.

sen.j: 649年（大化5年）、父蘇我倉山田石川麻呂が謀反の密告をされて自害。
sen.e: In 649, her father, SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro committed suicide since someone informed on his treason.
In 649, her father, SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro committed suicide since someone informed on his treason.
In 649, her father, SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro committed suicide since someone informed on his treason.

sen.j: この事件は夫である中大兄皇子の陰謀であるという説が有力である。
sen.e: Today the incident is widely considered to have been plotted by Naka no Oe no Oji.
Today the incident is widely considered to have been plotted by her husband, Naka no Oe no Oji.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを補足しました。
sen.e: Today the incident is widely considered to have been plotted by her husband, Naka no Oe no Oji.

sen.j: 享年は定かではないが、建皇子を産んで間もなく亡くなったとの説が多い。
sen.e: Her age at death is unknown; it is considered that she died soon after bore Takeru no Miko (Prince Takeru).
Her age at death is unknown; it is considered by many that she died soon after giving birth to Takeru no Miko (Prince Takeru).
sen.cmt: 後半を言い換えました。
sen.e: Her age at death is unknown; it is considered by many that she died soon after giving birth to Takeru no Miko (Prince Takeru).
